storyInfo: Siege and Delphine's team rescue Horn and Misery's group. Siege manages to destroy the Sarkaz war altars, successfully defending Chetleigh.

attributes.text: I was the first to see the scout.
While I scouted the silent government buildings next to the plaza on the other bank, his dead body drifting in the water, still grabbing the reeds by the bank.
\nIt seems he never gave up trying to survive.
\nNot far from him, his journal lay quietly in a waterproof pouch, the last entry written just before his departure.
'I volunteered for this mission to deliver the SOS. I won't come back, whether I succeed or fail.'
\n'No one will survive.' (Crossed out)

attributes.content: His journal indicates that the defenders of Chetleigh are in dire straits.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: See the crossing on the other side? The ferries have been sunk. Horn's squad has been completely cut off from the outside.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Two days ago, this soldier tried to cross the river under the cover of darkness, but was shot by the Sarkaz patrolling on the opposite bank.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There is no word from the troops that were garrisoned in the city hall.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: The soldier's journal made me uneasy.
\nTwenty-three soldiers, two squads.
\nOther than the city hall, silent in the darkness, the rest of the buildings around the plaza have been reduced to smoldering ruins by artillery fire.
\nAt least the tragedy hammers one thing: No one can truly escape death on the battlefield.

attributes.content: The Camus River runs to the east and north side of the plaza. The crossing to the east is under Sarkaz control. The lights coming from the south should be the Sarkaz camp.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They've holed up in the city hall for more than two weeks.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If the journal is accurate, the last bridge that connects the city hall to the residential district on the other side of the north bank was attacked no less than two days ago.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's possible that they're cut off from all supplies.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Out of ammo, out of food.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What do we do?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: If we have the time to worry about that here, we might as well just cross the river and see for ourselves.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: We can't just cross without a plan, Hannah. If we're discovered—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Actually, Hannah's words made me think.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We've been unable reach Horn's squad by radio. Restoring communications is our first priority.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Me, Hannah, Morgan, and Dagda will swim across the river and see what the situation is inside city hall.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That's too dangerous, Vina!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You realize that we're the best people for this job. The only people for this job.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We're Rhodes Island operators. Small squad spec ops is our game. And we're Norport gangsters, who know how to get into a place and get back out again unnoticed.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We have a few volunteer soldiers and civilians who want to offer their support for the legendary Tempest Platoon. But there are only so many people we can bring...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We need people to stay behind for defense, with Lieutenant Shearer gone.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: I hardly hear what Vina is saying.
\nIs this a bad joke by Trilby Asher? Or is this how the battlefield is?
\nThe call for help, deciding whether to answer, and the sacrifices that must be made to help... the laws of the battlefield.

attributes.content: I know what you're thinking, Delphine.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: There are personal sentiments involved, but I can't ignore the SOS.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: They're good soldiers, and they'll be of help if they're still alive.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Alright... I trust your judgment.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Stay behind with these men, Delphine. We need to keep watch.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If you lose our signal, take them and get out of here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Come back alive.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Okay, we're on the bank. Keep your eyes out for any patrols.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Two Sarkaz standing guard at the crossing. One to Hannah's 3 o'clock, another in the building.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Roger.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Draw the attention of the first, and Hannah and I will do this together. Three... Two... One... go!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: The light in the window goes out.
\nAll is well?
Wait... a fowlbeast?
\nA black fowlbeast flies out of the hut at the crossing, flies a circle above, then heads towards the Sarkaz camp.

attributes.content: Vina!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: An agile shadow leaps across the moonlight from the roof of the hut and grabs the fowlbeast.

attributes.content: Got it!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: A military fowlbeast. You spooked it, Hannah.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Sorry, I didn't notice.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: No sign of Sarkaz. To the city hall.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Lots of bodies on the plaza, but it's too dark to identify them. Ready to go in.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I see the bridge that connects the residential district, but the barricades on the other side of the bridge are blocking the view.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Go to the top of the city hall, try to get a better vantage.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Roger. Hm...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The entrance has been boarded up.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Over here. A gap has been blown in the west wall, wide enough for us to go in.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Good... do you see Horn's squad?
attributes.name: Delphine
Siege
attributes.content: Not yet.

attributes.name: Siege
attributes.content: Stop! Something's moving. Radio silence. There's a crossbowman in the building watching the residential district, allegiance unknown. Watch for my sign.
*Sarkaz profanity* What's that sound on this frequency? Who *Bzzzz—*
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.text: The signal goes silent.
I did not hear anything from them for the next ten minutes.
\nHow many men in the building? What's the situation with the surrounded troops? Has Vina's group been discovered?
\nI'm completely in the dark.
Crouched in the dirt on the banks, I feel my heart beat harder with every throb.
\nThe heartbeats merge into the river, resonating with the flow, growing faster and stronger—

attributes.content: I see you.

attributes.text: They've been discovered?
\nSomeone's waving from the top of the building, the moon at her back. It's... Vina?

attributes.content: Siege here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Horn, Tempest Platoon. Do you hear me?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We got your SOS. We've confirmed your location—the bridgehead at the residential district, on the other side.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We're coming to help.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: 'Bzzzzt— Bzzzzt—'
\nI hear cheers coming from the radio.
\nThey did it.

attributes.content: Sorry about that. The men are excited for our first bit of support.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We should be able to talk normally now.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Horn, we can help your squad evacuate—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Thanks, but we're not evacuating. There's something in this town that the Sarkaz want, and they won't abandon their assault.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The nearest Victorian battalion that received our SOS will arrive within one week. We must guard the entrance until then, and ensure the safety of the survivors of Chetleigh.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: *Radio noise*
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We voted on this. The decision was unanimous.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Including... Misery. Much obliged.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.text: Dead silence.
\nShe sounded like she was talking about the weather.
\nA vote. On a battlefield, there are only two choices you get to vote for: Life, or death.
Vina seems lost in thought. What decision would I make? What decision would Mother make?

attributes.content: Then...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If you choose to gamble, I have an even bolder plan. Care to hear it?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: I don't support Vina because she is the heir to the throne.
\nShe's brave, competitive, hates losing.
\nSome would call her reckless.
But I count on her to get us there, to find a way out of hell.
\nI have to believe in her. I have to believe to get out of this hell.
I can't even bring myself to think about what happened that day.
\nFocus, Delphine. Focus.
\nThe overwatch mission has ended. Time to meet up with them.

attributes.content: It's almost dawn. How go the preparations?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The windows and doors are being reinforced. Misery's been cleaning up enemy sentries.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'll continue to keep a watch on the outskirts.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: I'll get in touch if there are any changes at the camp.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Thank you, Misery.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We were supposed to meet up at Brentwood when we split up at Londinium. Why are you here at Chetleigh?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Misery noticed something unusual when we passed by. We got here in time to see a massacre, and we couldn't just walk away.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Are you sure you want me to be in charge? You're a professional soldier, Horn, and Delphine had elite military training.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I know what you guys did at the Mausoleum of Kings. You brought back that sword for us.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Just a piece of metal.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: P-Piece of metal? It's Victoria's Realmblade...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Stop thinking about the Sighs of Kings. This might disappoint you, but it won't bring any miracles.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We're the only ones we can count on.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And it's enough.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You've proven as much.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We don't have the personnel, condition or resources to implement complex tactics. What we need for the coming fight is courage and determination.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: In the face of disaster, the human spirit is much more important than any legend or artifact.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Prove it, Siege.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Most of us are not professional soldiers. We'll just tell them to take the high ground and shoot any enemy that approaches.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The few of us here will form a response team to take out any Sarkaz that gets past.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Horn's squad will continue to defend the bridgehead position, create a fire zone.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They will continue to fend off the Sarkaz trying to get across the bridge, as per the original plan.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: This building is the first line of defense. We'll be in the thick of things.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: All we need to do is to defend one building. How hard can it be?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The Defense of Camus River—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hey, that was what I was going to say! It would make a great movie.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Quiet, Hannah. Patrol approaching from 1 o'clock, hundred meters out. At the ready.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Shall we fire, Siege?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.text: Vina's hands were trembling.
\nExcitement? Fear? Or both?
\nI do not know. My hands are cold, almost frozen.
Seven days.
\nWill the dukes' troops really come? What if we fail? What if more Sarkaz notice?
\nI kept going over the possibilities in my head.

attributes.content: Now! Open fire!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: Sirens start blaring in the Sarkaz camp the moment the patrol goes down.
\nThere is no time to think. The Defense has begun.

attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary
attributes.content: My brothers will tear you apart, standing on my corpse, *Sarkaz profanity*...

attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary
attributes.content: Ugh...
I prefer to be the one doing the tearing, if that's all right with you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: Sarkaz.
\nOnce again, I think back to what happened that day. No, I can't.

attributes.content: It's almost ninety seconds, Delphine! Ready to pull back!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Roger! Bentley's down! I'll fill the gap in the minefield.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Mines are too precious to just leave out there.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You have fire support from the third floor.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The underground passage that connects the city hall's basement to the bridge has been cleared! Now the wounded have some space.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You took a nick, Morgan. Are you okay?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Not good enough to hold a knife, but I can coordinate things in the back.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What about your side, Hannah?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You're asking the expert of destruction. I could smash a hole in the ceilings without any extra equipment, and we have wooden ladders set up so that we can move quickly between the floors.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Good. We can't have another situation like yesterday, when we couldn't get to Dagda in time.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I filled the gap in the minefield! Bentley's still breathing, so I'm taking him into the basement for treatment.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Is Dagda awake?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Awake, but she can't be moved yet.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: She's been trying too hard. I'll do my best to care for her.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Is there any news from the Sarkaz camp? They may be planning something else, after the assault on the building failed.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Can you find any more mines to expand the minefield?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm afraid not. Our Sarkaz friend's mercenary band isn't so easy to find.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: We'll have to count on my *static*—
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Witchcraft *static* signal— disrupt *static*—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Something's disrupting the signal?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's —*noise*—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: —Del *static*— Run—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.text: I hear a long howl in the distance.
\nA strong sense of unease suddenly comes over me. The air has become filled with malice.

attributes.content: Delphine?
You're finally up.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I... my head hurts...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You didn't pull out in time while rescuing the wounded yesterday, and got caught by the blast of them test firing the war altar.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Yesterday...? War... altar? Where's Ben?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Hah, looks like we've both missed a lot.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Ach, my back still hurts. Morgan sucks at stitching. Oh, Ben's alive.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Who... who brought me back?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Hannah. She saw that you were still outside and jumped out from the third floor to drag you back in.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: She just woke up herself. She's gone off to support Vina.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: These are the wounded?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I walk through the underground passage, now filled with wounded personnel. Dozens of eyes turn towards me. Many of them still have dried blood upon them.
It's pretty bad. We need to hurry.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: The mines are pulling their weight. Two of the war altars have had their undercarriages disabled, and the rest have stopped.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: They've stopped their advance.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We can bombard the position you marked at any time!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Careful! The war altars are still charging. They haven't abandoned the assault yet!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Alright, listen up, you berks. The next round of bombardment is about to begin. Anyone still on the first and second floors, get your arses up the third floor!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: That thing can only shoot so high!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I believe that its witchcraft core is powered by its operator, the altar itself acting only as a medium.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: So it'll blow itself up if its witchcraft core is destroyed when fully charged?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: In theory, but I've never seen it in action personally. I can't guarantee—
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: That's good enough. I'll go up to the roof to look for an opportunity. The only way to approach the core is from above.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Can you distract the operator for a little while when the altar is activated? Every second helps.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: ...Will do.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Vina—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: I stand at the staircase to the second floor, dumbfounded.
It takes me some time to realize that the pile of rubble without the left side wall is the city hall that we've been defending for the better part of a week.
\nThe carnage on the plaza is in plain view, without the need for windows or portholes.
\nAmidst the ruins, the red crystals on the war altars shine an eerie red in the rays of dawn, the metal skeleton reflecting an ominous light.
\nIt seems to whisper: Gaze upon blood, gaze upon decay, gaze upon death.
This is what Mother had done for so long.
And this is the first time I've thought of her in days.

attributes.content: Welcome back, Delphine, Dagda.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Sarkaz have deployed these weapons en masse?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I don't think so. I believe it was developed by the Military Commission in Victoria. The design is still very rough around the edges.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Delphine, you look reasonably well for someone who just woke up from being knocked unconscious.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Morgan has been taking care of you two with one hand.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Thanks, Morgan. And Hannah.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Sorry about the trouble.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It was a piece of cake.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Alright, everybody, listen. I want rid of those altars, and for that I need help.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I need bait. Someone to stay here and keep those things firing...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Sounds like a job for me.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I can do it too—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This is no time to be acting tough. I know better than anyone else here how terrifying those things are.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Your hand's still injured, Morgan. I'll be the one to work with Hannah.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I need someone else on standby to take over the attack if I don't succeed. Misery can only buy so much time for us.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'll do it.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: What about me, Vina?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan... keep an eye on everyone.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: Vina's plan is a simple one. Wait for the altars to fire, smash the core, cause a chain reaction.
\nAll we need is an opportunity. And the opportunity has come.
They've taken aim.
\nThe malice is sickening.

attributes.content: They could fire at any time.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Not exactly a great feeling to be in that thing's crosshairs.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Misery?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Whenever you're ready—
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Do it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: Red.
\nThe color on the deck flashes back before my eyes.
The demonic eye in the altar peers at me.
It is averted by a silver arc.
\nThe dagger rips open the necks of a file of Sarkaz artillerymen, leaping back joyfully into Misery's hand.
\nTheir hands slow for a moment as they reach for the core, continuing their movements from before they died under the pull of inertia.
A hammer falls from the sky, impacting lightly with the red wave.
Bang.
\nVina is knocked back into the building like a comet.

attributes.content: No... Vina!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: Half a second.
\nThe altar activated faster than anyone expected.

attributes.content: *Cough*... *cough*...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: The hammer embeds itself in the broken wall.
\nI can't see anything in the dust and smoke.

attributes.content: Watch out! They've replaced the artillerymen and are preparing to fire again!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: The hammer is gone by the time I wipe the gravel from my eyes.
A figure climbs the outer wall swiftly, the hammer pulling her up like a pickaxe, the building trembling under every blow.

attributes.content: Dagda!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: Dagda grabs the hand that stretches out from within the light.
\nBrick and stone crack and break under Vina's heels. She leaps into the sky.
The red wave has begun to build.

attributes.content: Everyone, take cover!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Get down, Morgan!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Hngh...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: I look up in the storm.
\nShe walks upon the rays of dawn, her golden hair burning.
She raises her hammer high, and it becomes one with the sun.
\nThe wave is torn apart, rampant power streaking towards the core.
I lose my voice.
\nAll that remains is the light that stabs at my eyes.

attributes.content: Vina! Vina!
The altars are still exploding! Look out!
She's fainted! Damn, the metal shards got into her chest! Someone help me out!
Bring her back! Don't let Originium dust into the wounds!
The Sarkaz are retreating!
Hannah! Look! Over there!
Battleships? Reinforcements? Really? Th-That's the standard of Duke Gododdin!
It's... it's over...
It's over! We bloody made it! We did!
Ben! Ben! Look, we're saved! Ben? Ben...
Those damnable devils are trying to run! After them!

attributes.text: I should add another entry to the scout's journal.
'We survived.
\nIn memory of seven fallen heroes...
\nAbigail, of Norport, civilian. Alexandra, of Chetleigh, civilian.
\nHenderson, of Auchterigg, soldier. Bentley, of Lynncardine, soldier.
\nUnidentified body.
\nUnidentified body.
\nUnidentified... (illegible)'
